intro: Ammannia teixeirae, commonly known as the Teixeira ammannia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and unique characteristics, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
